div.div:
Refactors popular tours component for improved clarity
Removes unused imports and logs to streamline code readability.
Enhances filter handling by memoizing functions, reducing unnecessary re-renders.
Improves error logging specificity for better debugging and modifies city info retrieval logic for robustness.
Optimizes category sorting and ensures consistent handling of tour data.
Enhance meeting point details for Portland and Pucallpa tours with addresses, coordinates, instructions, and contact numbers for improved user guidance.

Enhance tour details for Berlin, Bhaktapur, and Blagaj
- Added new attributes to tours including popularity, adventure, cultural, culinary, spiritual, nightlife, wellness, luxury, and art/music indicators. - Updated meeting points with detailed addresses, coordinates, instructions, contact numbers, and emails for each tour. - Expanded FAQs for each tour to provide comprehensive information on accessibility, historical significance, culinary experiences, and local customs. - Improved descriptions of unique experiences and interactions with local culture, enhancing the overall tour offerings.
Refactor Beijing tour descriptions, pricing, and details for enhanced clarity and appeal; update images, meeting points, and FAQs for improved user experience.

Enhance Ayutthaya and Bali tour details with additional attributes, meeting points, and FAQs
- Added new attributes (isPopular, isAdventure, isCultural, etc.) to Ayutthaya tours for better categorization. - Updated meeting points in Ayutthaya tours to include detailed instructions, contact information, and coordinates. - Introduced comprehensive FAQs for each Ayutthaya tour to address common inquiries. - Enhanced Bali tours with new meeting points, FAQs, and additional tour options including Uluwatu Temple & Kecak Fire Dance and Ubud Monkey Forest & Rice Terrace Trekking. - Improved cancellation policies and inclusions/exclusions for clarity.

Enhance Atlanta and Atlas Mountains tours with detailed attributes and FAQs
- Added new attributes (isPopular, isAdventure, isCultural, etc.) to various tours in Atlanta and Atlas Mountains. - Included comprehensive meeting point details for each tour. - Expanded FAQs for multiple tours to provide better information on physical demands, accommodations, food, and cultural etiquette. - Updated cancellation policies and available dates for several tours.
Add meeting points and FAQs for Amsterdam and Anchorage tours; update images and tour details
Adds new attractions to Da Nang tour data, enhancing cultural and historical offerings

Refactors attraction and tour interfaces for clarity
Improves the structure of attraction and tour interfaces by introducing base interfaces and consolidating common properties.
This change enhances maintainability and readability, separating core attributes from specific flags and details.
Additionally, it standardizes the handling of shared properties, facilitating future expansions and modifications.
Update Da Nang tour details with new images, descriptions, and meeting points

Updates meeting point instructions to be required
Changes the meeting point's instructions property from optional to required.
This ensures that additional instructions are always provided for clarity in meeting arrangements.

Improves accent removal functionality in strings
Enhances the `removeAccents` function by adding specific replacements for characters "đ" and "Đ" before removing diacritical marks.
This ensures that accented characters are handled more accurately, improving string normalization.
Enhance city name processing by removing accents for tour data and attractions fetching

Updates import paths for tour categories
Refactors the import statements for tour categories to use the correct path, enhancing code organization and clarity.
No functional changes are introduced; this update improves maintainability.

Update import path for tourCategoryMap constants
Refactors the import statement for `tourCategoryMap` to point to the correct location in the `info` directory.
This change ensures that the application accesses the updated and accurate tour category constants, improving maintainability.
Add tour categories and mapping for quick lookup

Adds booking functionality and tour guide details
Implements a comprehensive booking interface for tours, including date selection and participant count.
Enhances the tour page by introducing features to fetch and display tour guides based on specialty, while presenting similar tours for user convenience.
Improves overall user experience with loading states and structured tour information display.
Remove meeting points from various tours in Anchorage, Athens, Atlanta, Atlas Mountains, Austin, and Bali; add popularity and other attributes to tours in Athens, Austin, Bali, and more.
Add detailed inclusions, exclusions, itineraries, highlights, and meeting points for Barcelona tours
Enhance meeting point details display with address, coordinates, instructions, and contact information
Update Tour interface to use MeetingPoint type for meetingPoint property
Fix import path for tour categories and correct variable name

Add tour categories and remove Sacred Valley Cusco tours
- Introduced a new file for tour categories with detailed descriptions and tags for various types of tours including cultural, culinary, wellness, and more. - Deleted the existing Sacred Valley Cusco tours file as part of a restructuring of tour offerings.

Update import path for city attractions
Changes the import path for city attractions to reflect the new directory structure.
This adjustment helps maintain a clean and organized codebase by ensuring all related files are correctly accessed.

Updates imports for city attractions and sorting utilities
Refactors the import structure by replacing the city attractions and utilities from their previous paths.
This change improves code organization by ensuring that the correct modules are sourced from their updated locations, enhancing maintainability and clarity in the PopularDestinations component.

Updates import path for city attractions and adds margin
Refactors the import statement for city attractions to point to the correct directory, enhancing code organization.
Additionally, adds a top margin to the attractions grid for better spacing in the layout.

Updates import path for city attractions data
Refactors the import statement for city attractions data to point to the correct module.
This change enhances code organization and ensures accurate data retrieval for the tourist information feature.

Adds filtering capabilities for tour guides
Implements a comprehensive filtering system for tour guides based on country, city, language, name, and specialty.
Introduces new input components for user interaction, enhancing the overall user experience and allowing users to easily find guides that match their preferences.
Also includes a reset functionality to clear all applied filters for convenience.

Adds button for viewing tours and refactors click handler
Implements a button to navigate to the tours page for each destination.
Refactors the click handler for city names to ensure better user interaction and improve code organization.
Updates import path for city attractions to enhance clarity.
Fix image source reference for tour guide profiles

Enhances tour filtering interface with slider
Replaces the price filter input fields with a slider for improved user experience.
Introduces a formatted price display and a reset filters button to streamline the filtering process.
Fixes issues with price range input validation and enhances overall filtering functionality.

Enhances attraction filters with additional options
Implements new filtering options for attractions, including "Family Friendly," "Culinary," "Spiritual," "Wellness," "Art/Music," and "Cultural."
Removes outdated filters such as "Shopping" and "Dining" to streamline the user experience.
Updates the user interface to reflect these changes, ensuring better usability in selecting destination preferences.

Adds filter toggle and card layout for driver filters
Introduces a toggle button to show or hide the filter section for available drivers, enhancing user experience by allowing dynamic visibility of filter options.
The filter options are now presented within a card layout for better organization and aesthetics. Additionally, the logic for displaying the minimum experience and language spoken filters remains intact, ensuring functionality while improving the UI.

Enhances vehicle rental filters with improved UI and interactivity
Implements a refined filter section for the vehicle rental feature, allowing users to toggle visibility and utilize a more interactive selection interface.
Adds dropdowns for passenger and sound system filters, replacing traditional select elements with a cleaner design.
Improves overall user experience by reducing clutter and enhancing usability, making it easier to find suitable vehicle options.

Adds filter functionality with improved UI for aircraft selection
Introduces a new filter section for aircraft selection, enhancing user experience by allowing dynamic visibility of filters.
Implements passenger and price filters using a modern card layout and select components, improving accessibility and organization.
Updates filter handling logic for a more intuitive interaction and clearer state management.
Fixes #123

Adds filter toggle and card layout for personnel
Implements a filter toggle button to show or hide personnel filters, enhancing user experience.
Wraps filter controls in a card layout for improved design and organization.
Maintains existing filter functionality for experience and language selection.

Adds filter section with toggle functionality
Implements a collapsible filter section for personnel, enhancing user experience by allowing users to show or hide filter options. Introduces a button to toggle the visibility of the filter options, improving layout and accessibility.
Integrates Card components for better styling and organization of filters.
Ensures filters for minimum experience and language spoken remain functional.

Enhances yacht filtering UI with collapsible filters
Implements a collapsible filter section for yacht rentals, improving user experience by allowing users to toggle filter visibility.
Updates the filter defaults to 'any' for cabins, privacy level, length, and passengers, enhancing usability.
Adds a reset filters button for convenience and maintains state consistency across filter options.
Refactor Attraction interface: add isCultural, isCulinary, isSpiritual, isWellness, and isArtOrMusic properties; remove isShopping and isDining properties.
Refactor Tour interface: add isCulinary and isSpiritual properties, remove isFoodAndDrink property.

Adds filtering functionality to tour listings
Implements a comprehensive filter panel for tours, allowing users to filter by duration, price range, rating, tour guide, category, and tags.
Enhances user experience by enabling dynamic filtering of displayed tours based on selected criteria.
Optimizes performance with memoization to efficiently calculate filter options and apply filters to the tour list.
Refactor TourPage component: remove family-friendly indicator, update FAQ display structure, and modify Book Now button functionality.
Add country field to TourGuide interface for enhanced location details
Fix city names in cityattractions for accurate representation: "Altas Mountains" to "Atlas Mountains", "Da Nang" to "Đà Nẵng", "Ho Chi Minh City" to "Hồ Chí Minh", and "Hoi Anh" to "Hội An".
Refactor TourPackages component to enhance UI with a custom button for navigating to tour guides, and improve the structure of the category display for better readability.
Refactor RentAYachtPage to replace select elements with custom Select components for improved styling and consistency, and update input elements for better user experience.
Refactor LuxuriousDestinations and Homestay components to enhance UI with custom input and select components, improve navigation with quick links, and update content structure for better readability.
Refactor TourGuides component to group and sort tour guides by country, add quick navigation, and enhance UI with buttons for better user experience.
Implement code changes to enhance functionality and improve performance
Add attractions data for Kampala, Ouarzazate, and Palawan including descriptions, images, and accessibility features
Refactor label elements to use the Label component for improved consistency and styling across various pages

Add attractions data for Hokkaido, Melbourne, and Zanzibar
- Created Hokkaido attractions list including Furano Flower Fields, Shirogane Blue Pond, and Sapporo Snow Festival. - Added Melbourne attractions featuring Federation Square, Royal Botanic Gardens, and National Gallery of Victoria. - Introduced Zanzibar attractions such as Stone Town, Prison Island, and Nungwi Beach.

Remove tour data for multiple cities including Milan, Philadelphia, Portland, Quebec City, Queenstown, Salzburg, San Sebastian, Santander, Santiago, Santorini, Seville, St. Petersburg, Taipei, Toronto, Wellington, and Zurich.
Implement code changes to enhance functionality and improve performance
Adds attraction data for Maui, Patagonia, and Zagreb, enhancing destination offerings
Removes outdated attraction data for Marrakech, Fes, and Philadelphia
Refactors filtering components to use Select for experience and language filters

Enhances filter reset functionality and label formatting
Implements a consistent button component for resetting filters, improving UI consistency.
Updates amenity and feature labels to use a capitalize utility for better readability.
These changes enhance the user experience by providing a cleaner interface.

Adds filtering options for aviation personnel
Implements functionality to filter aviation personnel by minimum experience and spoken language, enhancing user experience.
Introduces state management for filters and modifies the rendering logic to display only profiles that meet the selected criteria.
Adds a reset button to clear filters for convenience.

Refactors vehicle feature labels and resets buttons
Improves the readability of vehicle feature labels by applying a capitalization utility.
Replaces standard HTML buttons with a consistent UI component for reset actions, enhancing the visual coherence across the interface.

Adds filtering options for available drivers
Implements filter functionality based on experience and language for the driver profiles displayed.
Introduces state management for filters and enhances the user interface with dropdown selections.
Updates the driver display logic to reflect the applied filters, ensuring only matching profiles appear.
Improves usability by allowing users to reset filters easily.

Adds filtering functionality for crew members by experience and language
Implements a filtering system that allows users to narrow down the list of crew members based on minimum experience and spoken languages.
Introduces state management for filters and enhances the user interface with dropdown selections for ease of use.
The code also ensures that the displayed crew members are sorted and dynamically updates based on user input, improving the overall user experience.
